Create a Handsontable Widget

Source: R/handsontable.R
handsontable.Rd

Creates an interactive data grid using the Handsontable JavaScript library. The widget provides spreadsheet-like functionality including data validation, conditional formatting, formulas, and extensive customization options.

Usage

handsontable(
  data,
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL,
  adaptiveHeight = TRUE,
  colHeaders = TRUE,
  rowHeaders = TRUE,
  readOnly = FALSE,
  contextMenu = FALSE,
  elementId = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame, matrix, or other rectangular data structure

width, height

Widget dimensions. Can be specified as pixels (e.g., "400px") or percentage (e.g., "100 automatically determined.

adaptiveHeight

Logical. If TRUE (default), the table's height will automatically adjust based on the number of rows displayed. If FALSE, the specified height will be used.

colHeaders

Logical or character vector. If TRUE, shows default column headers. If character vector, uses custom column names.

rowHeaders

Logical. If TRUE, shows row numbers as headers.

readOnly

Logical. If TRUE, makes the entire table read-only.

contextMenu

Logical or list. If TRUE, enables default context menu. If list, provides custom context menu configuration.

elementId

Optional HTML element ID for the widget container

...

Additional configuration options passed to Handsontable

Value

An htmlwidget object for rendering the Handsontable

Examples

if (interactive()) {
  # Basic usage
  handsontable(mtcars)

  # With custom headers
  handsontable(iris, colHeaders = c(
    "S.Length", "S.Width", "P.Length",
    "P.Width", "Species"
  ))

  # Read-only table with context menu
  handsontable(airquality, readOnly = TRUE, contextMenu = TRUE)

  # Using pipe operator for configuration
  handsontable(mtcars) |>
    hot_cols(colWidths = 100) |>
    hot_table(contextMenu = TRUE)
}
